__data__.text:
ZSCALER 
ANTI-BRIBERY POLICY 
Amended October 27, 2017 
I. PURPOSE OF THIS POLICY
Zscaler has adopted this Anti-Bribery Policy (“Policy”) to ensure that Zscaler (and its partners,
affiliates, and agents) meets its legal and compliance obligations under the U.S. Foreign Corrupt
Practices Act (“FCPA”), the OECD Convention on Anti-Bribery, the United Kingdom Bribery Act of
2010 (“Bribery Act”), or any other applicable anti-bribery laws or international anti-bribery standards
(collectively the “Anti-Bribery Laws”).  Zscaler mandates compliance with the Anti-Bribery Laws in
all of the countries in which Zscaler operates or conducts business.  This Policy is applicable to all
Zscaler employees, directors, officers, board members, and any other individual or entity acting for or
on behalf of Zscaler, anywhere in the world (collectively “Zscaler Individuals”).
Violation of the Anti-Bribery Laws may have serious consequences including large civil and criminal
fines for Zscaler and fines and prison terms for the responsible Zscaler Individuals.
Violation of this Policy may be grounds for discipline, immediate termination, prosecution, or
additional sanctions.
II. POLICY STATEMENT
Zscaler Individuals will not make, offer to make, or promise to make a “bribe” to any person.
Zscaler Individuals will not provide, offer to provide, or promise to provide “anything of value”
to any “foreign official” unless such action has been approved in advance and in writing by the
Zscaler Legal Department.
All entertainment, meals, gifts or travel must be reasonable, not extravagant, and will only be
provided to customer personnel and other persons in accordance with the Entertainment,
Meals, Gifts & Travel Section of this Policy.
III. DEFINITIONS
A “bribe” is any offer or payment of “anything of value” made to an individual to induce that
individual to (a) act in bad faith or (b) violate a position of trust or duty of impartiality for the purpose
of securing a business advantage for Zscaler.
“Anything of value” includes cash, gifts, travel expenses, entertainment, offers of employment,
provision of free services, and business meals, regardless of the value.  It may also include event
sponsorships, consultant contracts, fellowship support, and charitable contributions (even if made to a
legitimate charity).
The term “foreign official” is interpreted broadly and includes, but is not limited to, any employee,
director, or officer of (1) a foreign or domestic government or any department, agency, or
instrumentality of a government; (2) a state-owned or controlled entity, including, in many countries,
Last reviewed May 2021

-2- 
telecom, health care, and educational institution employees; (3) a public international organization, 
such as the Red Cross or World Bank; or (4) a foreign or domestic political party, including 
candidates for political office, and members of royal families; as well as any person acting in an 
official capacity for or on behalf of such governmental bodies or public organizations, including 
entities hired to review and accept bids for a government agency. 
IV. ENTERTAINMENT, MEALS, GIFTS & TRAVEL POLICY 
General Policy 
Anti-Bribery Laws may prohibit certain kinds or amounts of entertainment, meals, gifts and travel 
provided to customer personnel and other persons under certain circumstances.  Therefore, no 
entertainment, meals, gift or travel should ever be offered, given or provided unless: 
∗ It is reasonable, not extravagant and appropriate under the circumstances and under U.S. and 
local customs; 
∗ It serves a valid business purpose and is directly related to the promotion, demonstration or 
explanation of products or services or the performance of a contract; 
∗ It is not offered for any improper purpose and cannot be construed as a bribe; 
∗ It does not violate this Policy or any other Zscaler policy; 
∗ It does not violate any U.S., local or international laws or regulations; and 
∗ It is accurately described in the expense reports and Zscaler’s books and records. 
The rules set forth in this Section apply whether you are giving the entertainment, meals, gifts and 
travel or other benefits yourself or through a third party. 
If you have any question regarding the appropriateness of any gift or expense, you should consult 
Zscaler’s Legal Department prior to incurring the expense. 
Policy for Foreign Officials 
The FCPA is a U.S. law that focuses on bribes provided to foreign officials.  Specifically, under the 
FCPA, individuals must not make, offer to make, or promise to make a bribe, directly or indirectly, to 
any foreign official to assist Zscaler in obtaining or retaining an improper business advantage, 
whether or not any benefit is actually received. 
The FCPA is very broad, so that many kinds of entertainment, meals, gifts and travel provided to 
foreign officials might be considered improper, regardless of their value.  As a result, the FCPA may 
prohibit actions that would not violate laws that govern transactions between commercial, non-
government parties. 
Therefore, Zscaler strictly regulates providing anything of value to any foreign official.  Zscaler 
Individuals will not provide, offer to provide, or promise to provide “anything of value” to any 
foreign official unless such action has been approved in advance and in writing by the Zscaler Legal 
Department.

-3- 
Internal Policies of Customer 
Customers’ internal anti-bribery policies may prohibit certain kinds or amounts of entertainment, 
meals, gifts and travel provided to their personnel.  Violation of these policies could result in 
discipline or termination of customer personnel who are proponents of Zscaler’s products and 
banning of Zscaler as a vendor to the customer.  As a result, Zscaler Individuals are responsible for 
confirming with the customer in advance and in writing that providing entertainment, meals, gifts, or 
travel will not violate the customer’s internal anti-bribery policies. 
Political Contributions 
No political contributions shall be made with corporate funds or assets (including reimbursing 
contributions made by individuals) regardless of whether the contributions are legal under the laws of 
the country in which they are made. 
Charitable Contributions 
Unless approved by the Chief Legal Officer and Chief Financial Officer, no charitable contributions 
shall be made with corporate funds or assets (including reimbursing contributions made by 
individuals). 
V. REPORTING VIOLATIONS 
If any Zscaler Individual knows or believes that any bribe has been or will be made, the Zscaler 
Individual must report such bribe to the Zscaler Legal Department.  Zscaler Individuals have a right 
to report violations of this Policy without fear of retaliation.  Zscaler will not take any adverse action 
for making a good faith report of a possible violation, or participating or assisting in good faith in the 
investigation of an alleged violation. 
Zscaler Individuals must monitor for any “red flags” which may indicate or create circumstances that 
may allow for a violation or potential violation of this policy.  Red flags may appear in many forms 
and can include: 
∗ Accusations of improper business practices of any Zscaler Individuals; 
∗ Familial or other relationship between any Zscaler Individual and a foreign official that could 
improperly influence the decision of a foreign official; 
∗ Consultant’s insistence upon receiving a commission payment before the announcement of a 
contract or decision; 
∗ Demands for extraordinarily high commissions or fees for services; 
∗ Requests for cash payments or “off-book” payments; 
∗ Requests for additional commissions; 
∗ Demands for lavish entertainment, gifts, or travel in connection with negotiations; 
∗ Requests by a foreign official for employment of friends/relatives; 
∗ Recommendations by a foreign official to use a particular consultant; 
∗ Large, unsupported petty cash transactions; 
∗ Use of side letters; 
∗ Paying consultants for unspecified or otherwise questionable services; or

-4- 
∗ Requests that a commission or payment be made in a third country or to another name or 
company different from the one earning the commission. 
VI. REPRESENTATIVES 
Zscaler uses local representatives (e.g. resellers and service provider partners) as a way of doing 
business.  These representatives are retained in part for their knowledge of and access to persons in 
the local market and for their ability to secure and retain business.  The prohibitions of this Policy 
apply to Zscaler representatives who may act on Zscaler’s behalf.  Zscaler must ensure that its 
representatives comply with the Anti-Bribery Laws and this Policy.  Therefore, as it deems necessary, 
Zscaler will require such local representatives to provide due diligence information and complete 
certifications of compliance with this Policy.  Zscaler will terminate relationships with any local 
representative or any other third party who is unable or unwilling to comply with this Policy. 
VII. BOOKS AND RECORDS 
All Zscaler Individuals must maintain accurate records of all transactions and assist in ensuring that 
the Zscaler’s books and records accurately reflect, with appropriate detail, all transactions, expenses, 
or other dispositions of assets.  To that end, all cash, bank accounts, investments and other assets of 
Zscaler must always be recorded accurately on the official books of Zscaler.  Employees responsible 
for Zscaler’s financial books, records and internal accounting controls will periodically review such 
books, records and controls to ensure their compliance with Anti-Bribery Laws.  Bank accounts will 
be opened or closed only upon the prior written approval of Zscaler’s Controller. 
VIII. CERTIFICATIONS & TRAINING 
Certifications 
Zscaler Individuals will certify compliance with this Policy when requested by Zscaler’s Legal 
Department. 
Training 
Zscaler Individuals will be required to take anti-bribery compliance training as necessary to perform 
their duties as determined by the Legal Department. 
IX. OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT RESPONSIBILITY 
Zscaler Individuals are individually responsible, by action and supervision as well as continuous 
review, to ensure strict compliance with this Policy. 
Zscaler’s Legal Department is primarily responsible for the oversight and enforcement of this Policy.  
The Legal Department is further responsible for investigating any reported violations of this Policy. 
All questions regarding this Policy should be directed to Zscaler’s Legal Department.

EMPLOYEE CERTIFICATION 
I make the following certifications: 
• I have reviewed the Zscaler Anti-Bribery Policy (the "Anti-Bribery Policy").
• I agree to abide by Anti-Bribery Policy.
• I agree to report any potential violations of the Anti-Bribery Policy to my supervisor, 
the People & Culture Department, or the Legal Department. 
• I understand that failure to comply with the Anti-Bribery Policy and  
applicable ethical standards, and laws may result in disciplinary action (including  
immediate termination) by Zscaler and prosecution by law enforcement.
